text.0: how may the mind draw nigh to please thee agni what hymn of praise shall bring us greatest blessing.
text.1: or who hath gained thy power by sacrifices or with what mind shall we bring thee oblations.
text.2: come hither agni sit thee down as hotar be thou who never wast deceived our leader.
text.3: may heaven and earth the allpervading love thee worship the gods to win for us their favour.
text.4: burn thou up all the rākṣasas o agni ward thou off curses from our sacrifices.
text.5: bring hither with his bays the lord of soma here is glad welcome for the bounteous giver.
text.6: thou priest with lip and voice that bring us children hast been invoked here with the gods be seated.
text.7: thine is the task of cleanser and presenter waken us wealthbestower and producer.
text.8: as with oblations of the priestly manus thou worshippedst the gods a sage with sages.
text.9: so now o truthfullest invoker agni worship this day with joybestowing ladle.
